author: Mike Kelly
title: Gina Miller deserves a medal not online abuse for her Supreme Court victory
text:
Gina Miller deserves a medal not online abuse for her Supreme Court victory Ms Miller's fight was about defending democracy and not subverting it Share Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
Gina Miller deserves a medal not the online abuse she is getting from the people’s keyboard militia and the dog whistle blowers in the right wing press who shapes their views. 
However there is more chance of Nigel Farage becoming Lord Farrago of Trumpton than Ms Miller getting a gong for essentially safeguarding the sovereignty of parliament. 
Instead as she’s black, the daughter of immigrants and was a supporter of Remain , Ms Miller possesses a triple whammy of character ‘defects’ in the minds of knuckle draggers the length and breadth of In-ger-lund who have pilloried her remorselessly. Nigel Farage and Gina Miller appear on The Andrew Marr Show (Photo: Getty Images Europe) 
Ms Miller was not challenging the legitimacy of the Brexit vote . She was basically making sure the exit deal from the EU was discussed and ratified by parliament. 
Bizarrely, what Theresa May and her government were doing when they took her on was in effect to challenge the legitimacy of parliament. I know the Tories believe in ‘Small Government’ - but no government? Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Theresa May: UK left the EU to embrace the world Share this video Watch Next 
The most vocal in their condemnation of Ms Miller was UKIP who characterised her as someone intent on denying the will of the people who backed Brexit and won the popular vote. 
Yet its figureheads are now busy sucking up to Donald Trump who lost the popular vote to Hillary Clinton in the US presidential election by three million votes and condemn anyone who point this out as ‘sore losers’. 
(However, in case I’m accused of promoting fake news, I should point out that Trump believes the result was skewed by the three to five million as yet unlocated illegal immigrants who voted for Clinton, not to mention those damned unicorns, elves and leprechauns). 
Ms Miller’s stance was backed by judges first in the High Court and then the Supreme Court. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Supreme Court says Article 50 must be triggered by parliament Share this video Watch Next 
No doubt mindful of the abuse about to come their way for their decision, the judges chose to stress they were addressing a legal not a political question. Sadly it didn’t save them from a fair few ‘hang ‘em high’ editorials. Read More 
The fact a court challenge by Ms Miller was needed is a symptom of a worrying and growing trend among politicians who seem to resent outside scrutiny of their decisions. Gina Miller (Photo: PA) 
Another example came last week when it was revealed that in a test a Trident missile misfired and veered towards the US. You would have thought it was something the public which is to be asked to fork out at least £40bn on its renewal should have been informed of. 
But not a bit of it. The Commons, which was debating and voting on Trident renewal at the time, was kept in the dark. Read More Women told to wear high heels and dye hair, workplace study shows 
When the pooterish Defence Minister Sir Michael Fallon was asked to explain why to the Commons, he adopted what seemed a ‘none of your business’ attitude. 
Who actually pays his salary? I was left wondering, and will it take another Gina Miller-type case from a member of the public to find out exactly what motivates our government? Like us on Facebook
